description.narrative: By 2016, 9 million deprived population in rural and urban communities in 23 districts practice positive hygiene behaviour facilitated by adequate water and sanitation promotion

sector.narrative: HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities disaster prevention and preparedness
Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Bangladesh: Evaluation of Gender in the UNICEF Bangladesh Country Programme 2017-2020
2019 Bangladesh: Formative Evaluation of Meena Communication Initiative

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, 9 million deprived population in rural and urban communities in 23 districts practice positive hygiene behaviour facilitated by adequate water and sanitation promotion

description.narrative: By 2016, with the contribution of the UNICEF hygiene promotion programme, WASH messages reached a 7.44 million people, resulting in reported increases in hygiene behaviour. UNICEF-supported improved sanitation facilities and scalable safe water delivery models facilitated increased opportunities for improved hygiene. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Additional number of people with access to sanitation in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Proportion/number of people in programme area using sufficient, year-round, safe drinking water (= 50 ug/l As and <1 CFU/100 ml)

actual.value: 2016:16.5%, over 1.54 million people, in programme areas using sufficient, year-round safe drinking water

title.narrative: Proportion/number of target population in programme area who wash both hands with soap after defecation

actual.value: 2016:42.4%, 7.44 million people, reached by hygiene promotion and wash both hands with soap and water after defecation

title.narrative: Proportion/number of target people in programme area using improved sanitation facilities

actual.value: 2016:58%, over 1.45 million people, using improved sanitation facilities

title.narrative: Proportion/number of people practising open defecation in rural programme areas

actual.value: 2016:4.4%, equal to 1.94 million people, practicing open defecation in programme areas
